The portions are very generous, which means lots of amazing leftovers to sit in your fridge and get even more spicy depth and flavor over the next day or two.  And the rice pudding- deeelish!  The only thing that I wouldn't rave about was the Masala chai tea, and that's just because I like my chai blend with a little more punch, and this had quite a bit of milk in it.    The ambiance is lovely and perfect for a romantic evening, a place to take your folks when they're visiting and you want to prove you're All Grown Up, or an upscale but not crazy-expensive girls' night out.

Great Indian food! The food is absolutely delicious. They've got a  pretty large variety of items on the menu, so be sure to explore it a little.  The service was also very good. From the time we entered until we left, it was all about service.  Great experience, highly recommended, and we'll definitely be back again.

Great lunch! Not a large portion per meal and some items are not paired with sides. This is not your quantity over quality type of place. Food was excellent and extremely tasty.  We will definitely be returning.

The Dhaba was not what I expected in that, the interior is actually well done.  I know that seems odd, but I'm so used to walking into a new Indian restaurant and being a bit irritated by the cheesy decor.    Anyhow, this place is just an alright Indian restaurant.  I ordered my standard chicken tikka masala and enjoyed it.  The spiciness wasn't where I wanted it to be, but I'm used to that.  It wasn't amazing, but it also wasn't bad.  Just okay.  Pierre puts it well in his review- "the tastiness of the food is good but unspectacular by Indian restaurant standards."  Our service was average.  The man working seemed to want to help us out, but forgot things on a few occasions throughout the meal.    With the convenience of a being right near a light rail stop, I'd most definitely stop here again if I were craving Indian and in Tempe, but I don't believe I'd go out of my way to come back here.  Just another okay Indian place in PHX.

We experienced Dhaba with a Groupon.  We went there during an off hour so the place was relatively empty.  We were humored when the staff asked if we had reservations.  Was that necessary?  Lovely atmosphere and the staff is attentive. We ordered the plate specials.  Mine came with naan, chicken curry, chana masala, dahl and rice.    The rice is like a fried rice with various veggies in it.  A nice change from the usual.  We both ordered medium spicy and it was just right.  Had the food been any spicier, it would have ruined the taste.  Hubby had the naan, lamb curry, dahl, tandoori chicken and rice.  It was all delicious.  Our meal was complete with chai and rice pudding with a mango flavoring.  There was plenty of  leftovers for the next day.  We would definitely go back as we thought this was one of the best places for Indian food.

The Dhaba is actually the best Indian restaurant for food in the Phoenix metro, and deserves a 5 star for food. We rate a 3 star to help them get better on service. We ordered a Biryani dish and 2 curry dishes and a garlic naan. The curry dishes each came with basmati rice, but they only gave us one basmati telling us we will not need the other because of the biryani. They said we could ask for the other basmati if we still wanted it later. We felt cheated because we paid for two basmati and expected two basmati without having to ask for more. This place is really expensive, too, and for them to try and cheat people out of rice is just not right. They could also improve on service by checking in to see that all is well at the table, and that our needs are met.

While the food is excellent, service is slow and the kitchen slower.  We have been here many times but won't be back.  Had a 6:30 reservation and didn't get out until 8:30!  After being seated, it took about 15 minutes for someone to take our order.  We waited over half an hour to have the food brought to our table.  Restaurant needs more waitstaff and more people in the kitchen.  VERY SLOW and inefficient.

Huge menu! If you're new to indian food be prepared to be confused. Waiter was helpful with recommendations. Chicken Tikka Masala was delicious as was the garlic naan. The Vindaloo was spicy! It comes at a 10 spice level. I took one bite and my head decided to go swimming. In my sweat. Good thing is they keep the place extremely chilly and serve water in these metal cups that keep the water ice cold. Service was also great. They kept that ice cold water refilled as I was trying to put the fire out in my mouth.

Where do I even start, this place is an absolute gem so good, the best Indian food I've ever had in my life.. Reminds me so much of being in the middle east. I got the Tikka Masala and the curried chick peas. I recommend everything on the menu

Great food. This place is cozy, and had water, flat bread, and 3 sauces ready to go at our table when we sat down.  Staff was just the right amount of attentive. Price was quite reasonable for the amount of food we got.  Favorite Indian place I have gone to in Phoenix.

I stopped at this place while doing a party bus event. How fun!! Ms Cenestra Lemons was our tour guide. She is fun, engaging and makes everyone fee welcome.  This place had some delicious food and a good thai tea.  Will return with my family.
Good food. The wait time was too long for a pick up. Their dal makhani was good, seriously!

My husband and I decided to celebrate my birthday a little early. We had received a Groupon for the Dhaba as a Christmas gift and decided to use it on 01-01-13.    Upon walking into to nearly empty restaurant, we were seated and told our server would be with us. Once she discovered we had the Groupon, she told us they didn't accept them on this day because it was a holiday. We promptly left.   Once in our car we checked the Groupon and discovered that New Year's Day was not one of the days listed as a day the coupon would not be accepted. So what the heck?   This is our second time at the Dhaba. After receiving shoe-leather lamb and being told it was always cooked that way, we almost didn't want to give it a second chance. After not being able to use a perfectly good coupon on day not listed in the fine print, we will not be returning to the Dhaba.    We'll eat at Star of India on Chandler Blvd. instead. The lamb there is cooked to perfection.

Excellent Indian food. Vast menu and you can get mild to very spicy. The naan is the best I've ever had in phoenix. I also like that they put the estimated calories on each meal. The service was excellent and the owner has a an awesome life story.

I can't stop raving about this place its a bit pricey but their food is amazing. All of their meat is juicy and flavorful. I've never been disappointed with the service.  I'm in love with their Samosas and Garlic naan. I wish it was endless!! Everyone I take here loves it. My only word of advice is to be sure you ask for the spice level you really want and commit to it lol.

Yum!!!!!  This was my first time trying Indian food & I am now hooked!  We arrived around 8pm on a Thursday & the place was packed & we were told it would be about a 45 minute wait, we decided to stay and we got lucky & were seated in about 10 minutes.  We were so happy that we waited.  The food was absolutely delicious, so much flavor.  The only reason I am giving 4 stars instead of 5 is because once we ordered, we never saw our waitress again & we had to ask the bus boy for more water & he even took our dessert order.

Every time I get a craving for Indian food, The Dhaba always satisfies. With the intimate environment, great food and great service, The Dhaba was a great experience.   My wife and I had their lunch special and was provided a full course meal for a great bargain. The meal started with a fresh salad. I ordered the lamb and it was tasty and didn't have the smell that most other Indian restaurants have I. Their lamb dishes. The sauce and garlic naan was delicious. My wife had the chicken tikka masala and that was great as well. To top off the meal was a clean rice pudding that refreshed the palate. Highly recommended.

This place used to be chaat corner - its recieved some massive plastic surgery. Nice ambiance, not any way like an authentic indian dhaba, but the food inside makes up for it.  The lamb curry was thick, spicy, and rich in potatoes. It made my stomach happy.  Stay away from the goat curry. That curry singlehandedly took away a star. It was flavorful enough, but it was thin and the quality of the meat was questionable.  The thalis won't disappoint - they're reminescent of thalis from north Indian dhabas.    The desserts are authentic. And they usually bring you out free fresh hot tea.  We went in a big group and our waiter was pretty darn good.

Like the good from The Dhaba.  It's a little pricey.  They occasionally have groupons which makes it more reasonable.  They're very into having reservations.  It's a small restaurant and when we've gone, their tables fill up.  I do recommend calling ahead.  The Faislabadi Aam Murgh is very good if you want to try something new.

The Dhaba has been on my wife's list for a long time, and I'm glad she finally convinced me to go, because it was amazing.  I'm not that familiar with Indian cuisine, and the dinner menu at Dhaba is extensive, so it took a while to figure things out.    Tip:  Make a reservation.  We did and were sat immediately at a table marked "reserved".  We noted several parties who arrived while we were having dinner who did not make reservations and were actually turned away entirely.  MAKE A RESERVATION.    I had a double deuce Indian beer called Kingfisher that was enjoyable, ordered a chaat and pakoras for the table to start (don't remember which ones and I don't see either of them on the online menu unfortunately), and the shehenghahi palak kofta for my main course, along with a Jantar Mantar (assortment of four kinds of naan bread) for the table.     Meanwhile, they bring out a plate with papadums and the three chutneys ranging from sweet/mild to medium/hot to hot/hot.  The hot hot was very hot, and my favorite was the sweet/mild which I believe was a tamarind.   All were delicious.    We actually asked for a second cup of the tamarind chutney it went so quickly.    The chaat was chick peas in a sauce with a naan bread-like base under the sauce and it was incredible.  Very tasty and not at all spicy.  It might have been the samosa chaat, but I'm not sure.  Either way, we all loved it.    The pakora "street treat" came in a pair and was also quite delicious.  They're like fritters, and actually fairly large for what they are.  We found ourselves spreading some of the tamarind chutney on them as well.    Next was my shehenghahi palak kofta "fit for royalty" vegetarian dish.   I really am not even sure how to describe this dish other than a heavy green sauce with cheese dumplings in it.   The flavor was out of this world!   I decided to man up and ordered it at a 6 out of 10 spice level.  I enjoy spicy food, and 6 out of 10 made me sweat.  It was very hot.  Definitely cleared out my sinuses haha.   What I find amazing is that they can adjust the heat level without impacting flavor.  I would order this same exact dish again, but take it down to a 4 on the spice level and I think I'd truly enjoy it.  I highly recommend this dish.    We all also enjoyed the Jantar Mantar assortment of naan breads and it was a huge portion for the 3 of us!  We ended up taking most of the naan home.     My one beer, my wife's 2 glasses of wine, step daughter's special Dhaba lemonade, 2 apps, 3 entrees, an extra side of rice and the assortment of naan breads came to a total of about $105.   If we had stuck to water, it would have put it in the $$ range but with the drinks it was definitely in the $$$ range....and WORTH IT.     Next time we go, I'll try desert if there's room in the belly!   We had a ton of leftovers to take home this time around.  Like a full 2nd meal for 3 people worth of leftovers....

This little restaurant may serve up the best Indian fare I have ever eaten.  It is indeed a rather small and unpretentious place in the center of Indian Plaza.  There might be ten tables at most and reservations are a must.  They actually had to turn away people while we were eating.  The menu is enormous, the foods well described and the choices unique--even for Punjabi cuisine.  The chili stuffed Naan was delicious and different.  The chicken vindaloo was rich and fragrant, if a little on the tepid side of the heat scale for me-- but then again just about all food is unless I order it spicy.  The okra was the best I have ever had and my wife's chicken tikki was superb.  The food was served quickly and the servers were friendly although a bit distracted.  We drove 45 minutes from Anthem to eat here and we will return.  I highly recommend The Dhaba.

This review is long overdue, as Dhaba has been perhaps the favorite restaurant if my wife and I for the last 5 years! Simply put: we have never have had a bad item here...it's amazing Indian food and accompaniments. We especially love the chicken curry and various naan breads. They also have a pretty good beer & wine list. Also, the atmosphere is very relaxing - perfect for a date night or small group gathering.

You have to have a picky Indian to recommend and suggest a menu for you to enjoy this place. We had a good offer for a menu that included (Pappad & chutnies, appetizer samosa/pakora, a chicken dish, Malai Kofta (vegetable fritter in a tomato cream sauce), Daal, Naan, Rice, Ras Malai (dessert) and of course Chai.  Everything tasted really good and was more than enough to leave us satisfied! It is a bit small, but cozy, and the owners were around, so we had a really good attention. Unlike other "indian places" this one had much more flavor!! Good thing is around the corner from where I live :)

Mmmm... I love this place. My friend and I found it on accident several years ago. I always get the Kashmiri Chicken Tikka Masala and naan. Lots of naan; garlic and plain to dip into the sauce of my chicken tikka masala!!!   Took my husband there last night for his first time trying Indian food. He got one of the grilled items Murgh Seekh Kabab. The herbs and spices were really strong and probably not a good choice for a first timer. The owners recognized that he didn't eat any if it and took it off our bill. They sincerely apologized and told is to ask them for advice the next time we go there.
Great food but very expensive. Several nearby places offer same quality at lower price.

As I am writing this for whatever reason the Punjab Pimp Daler Mehndi is thumping in my head " Tunook, Tunook mmm Da Da Da". I first want to mention the extreme politeness I get whenever I call to place a take out order. They, unlike other Indian cuisine restaurants want my business...yours too; and it shows. The menu is very broad which I love. They have full vegan entrees, although I am not close to being vegan I do love alot of vegetable dishes and DHABA has many. The vegetable "meatballs" are outstanding. I have never had a bad meal hear although some of my favorite go-to foods I can find better eleswhere. So everytime I do eat here I get something new. My go to items by the way are Mushroom Matar, Palak paneer and a protein i.e. Lamb, goat or chicken. The dishes here always are fresh, fragrant, plentiful, bright and overall spiced very nice. I prefer VERY HOT food in temperature and they nail it; I prefer my food extremely hot in spice too which they tend to be mellow on for my taste buds. Please, Sir Chef...Go on and hurt me with the magical indian spices, it's ok. If I order a ten it should be blazing!! With all this said DHABA is unique in it's offerings, clean in presentation and overall a pretty good Indian joint!! I will continue to eat there. If you are an employee of ANY INDIAN restaurant in Arizona here me now. You are from the continent ASIA....take a cue from your counterparts and GIVE RICE WITH DISHES FOR FREE. JUST PLAIN WHITE RICE!! I do get irked that this cuisine charges for this plain starch.

Been going here regularly for a while. Now sometimes we get it and it is watered down and isn't as spicy as it used to be; this has happened on two occasions thus far. The rice is strange sometimes too. I don't know if they changed cooks or not. The soft drinks are $3 each which is outrageous. We have also experienced the 18% tip issue mentioned on here before. $17 per person for lunch! It is a shame because it used to be so good. :-(

Changing my rating to 3 1/2 stars based on the fact that the owner contacted me about my experience there and seemed truly apologetic for it.  He has offered me & my husband to come in for lunch and he will see to it that our experience (service) is better than the last time.  As I said in my original review, we liked the food, it was the service that was so lacking.  Looking forward to trying it again and may re-rate again. (Thanks Raveen)

Experience in a single word - HORRIBLE . Went two times there and came back with horrible experience. First time I visited with my friends at 8:40pm and the manager or the owner told us that the restaurant was close whereas on their website closing time was 9pm. On the very next day, we again went there this time reserving a table for 8pm and again we were disappointed as they couldn't accommodate us by giving a shitty excuse and attitude. I feel they don't give a shit about their customers especially the NEW ones and the whole staff is arrogant. I don't think I would visit this place again or would recommend it to anyone.

The Dhaba never disappoints!  The staff is always friendly and professional. You are always greeted and appreciated. The food is amazing and puts you in a euphoric state, the spices and aromas impact the senses. Love, love this place. My Punjab grandfather would eat here and love it

This Punjabi is a Must Have!  By far best Indian (Punjab) cuisine my wife and I have encountered in the Valley of the Sun!  Taking advantage of Restaurant Week, we were able to thoroughly enjoy a both esthetic and flavorful, if not flamboyant trip to India within The Dhaba's culinary and dcor environment!  The moment you arrive, you are struck by their museum-like front displaying glass encased ornaments, clothing and more such as kurtis with Phulkari - and exhibited are Indian Auto Rickshaws showing both incredible intricate hand-made design and real wear!  And, the as you enter the front door, you set foot into a very traditional and very authentic environment seeming to take you back in time to Raj also known as the British India period!  Keep in mind this area of the world dates its heritage and cuisine to the Indus Valley Civilization (dating as far back as 1900 BCE).  This Northern Indian Cuisine which boasts Pakistani influences (Pakistan borders Punjab) drives its influence in their incredible foods.  Both my wife and I enjoyed everything we tried, quite a bit.  The prices are very reasonable, considering the hefty portions they dish (which in many instances will require boxes for take-home!), and the quality and adherence to authenticity The Dhaba offers.  Regarding the food, starting with my wife's white wine and I a large bottle of Taj Mahal Beer, we then took the opportunity to try starting with their: Samosa Plate (very refreshing and unique salad), freshly baked Naan Bread; my wife had the Cashmiri Chicken Tikka Masala (chicken breast marinated in traditional spices and yogurt and prepared in a Tandoori) while I had the exquisite and tender rendition of the Lamb Curry (lamb cubes with Dhaba spices) we finished off with deserts of Badami Kheer and wonderful Indian Rice Pudding, and I had the Gulab Gamun (spongy milky balls in rose syrup!  As I mentioned, by far the best we've had in the area.  Highly recommended to Aficiondos and newbies to Punjab alike!  Great atmosphere, attention, service, price and quality... a very enjoyable experience - we'll be back!  Bon apptit from Gstro Eclctico.         ('you will enjoy your meal').

Positives :  - No qualms about the entrees. Really good food - always rich and flavorful .   Negatives :  - Salad has a bitter taste & would be great if they are at least flexible in replacing the salad with lassi - so that people get to enjoy the better things Dhaba has to offer - Customer service - the lady at the entrance is extremely disinterested and never friendly

Chicken tikka masala, tandoori chicken, chicken korma, lamb vindaloo, keema samosas, chilli-pepper naan, garlic naan, carrot fudge, rice pudding, raita, basmati rice, adjustable spice level 1-10, generous and grateful staff, soft sitar and tabla playing in the background, what more could I ask?

I tried this place a while back. It was very good from what I remember. I had curry and it was spiced pretty well, it had a tomato like taste to it. I'm not sure if this is "Indian curry flavor" as I am Filipino and we use coconut milk. It was still very good and there were decent portions. The atmosphere was nice (although if I'm honest atmosphere doesn't matter in the presence of good food). It was a bit expensive for me as I am a student, but it was still worth it.
I love this place so much. Order it via postmates all the time and after a lot of searching for really good indian in AZ I feel like I found it!
Food was really good. Very spicy so go with a low number if you want it mildly spicy.

Very good Indian food. Went there with a party of 4. The beers were a bit pricy but the food's quality for the price matched. The heat level of the food was spot on. A 1-10 scale very true to what you say. Service was great especially for a Indian restaurant. I would highly recommend the shrimp curry and the chicken tikka masala     The menu is huge. Something for everyone.

The Dhaba is my go-to Indian good place, I love it!!! It is the best Indian food I've had in the valley. It's very small and I recommend making a reservation in advance to be safe. On occasion they do put out a groupon that is insane!   Foods I recommend: Chai tea (free refills!) Chicken tikka masala Paneer tikka masala Lamb vindaloo Garlic naan Raita

I am a big fan of Indian food, and The Dhaba is as good as it gets. Raveen, the owner gave us the best service as he chatted with us and shared his story, which is amazing.   I ordered the fish vindaloo and it was the freshest, juiciest fish I have had with an exquisite sauce. It was so good I HAD to bring a dish home for my wife, which was the chicken tikka masala. Her words after eating was "that was Amazing!"  It just doesn't get better than this. Do yourself a favor and try it out!

Even being of Indian decent, I've never really cared for this type of food. A few years ago, I visited this place for the first time and fell in love! The flavors are so unique and the atmosphere is so peaceful. Next to the amazing food, the service is good and the restaurant is always clean. Before you come, take the time to make a reservation online or by phone.
My favorite go to Indian restaurant. Friendly staff and delicious menu. The lunch specials are where it's at.

We did not make the trek to the east side with The Dhaba on our minds... But as we drove past it to our intended destination, I said "look honey, that's Dhaba, it gets great reviews and has been written up in Phoenix Magazine."  The Main Man replied, "its Indian, right? We like Indian, that naan bread, mmmmmm."  So we did what we went east to do and decided we had to give The Dhaba a go.  There was NO wait even though we had no reservation.  The hostess/waitress/manager was an absolutely gorgeous young woman who was very much into our learning experience and helped us sound out and pronounce our orders, lamb dishes for both of us.  We were given water and tea in a more than timely manner and the slight wait for our hand-made, fresh food was well worth it!  MM got the basmati rice and I opted, reluctantly as I steer clear of most carbs unless they are chocolate cake or cookies, for the brown rice.  Both were FABULOUS with the moist, tender lamb.  Both dishes of lamb were spicy without burning and the flavor was FINALLY noticeable... Most Indian food in the Valley honestly lacks heat, kick, and flavor... These dishes delivered in all three.  What I did not notice until it was time for the 'go' box is that the brown rice has the most elegant, aromatic scent.  I may not actually eat it, but I will go to the fridge a million times just to smell it!   All in all, we were lucky to grab up a table with no reservation, the food was awesome, the service pleasantly solid.  We are just sad The Dhaba is way across town...
YUM! Best Indian in Phoenix/Tempe. You can smell how great this place is from the parking lot. Service is super friendly and informative. Everything tasted amazing!

The food gets 5 stars most definitely. What brought our experience down was one of the servers. We had contact with two. One was a younger lady who seemed to be irritated that we had little experience ordering at an Indian restaurant and needed a little help with the menu. When she attempted to explain her accent was so thick we still found it hard to understand what we were doing. when asked to repeat herself she became even more irritated and only spoke louder, she then left the table and could be overheard saying 'I don't know what to tell her' in reference to my date's very basic questions.   Then an older lady who appeared to be the owner came to our table and was fantastic, she explained everything to us and was very attentive for the rest of the meal.   I would eat there again however it seems that they are big on making reservations. This didn't really occur to us as it was late Friday afternoon and we were thinking we'd get an early 'happy hour' dinner in at the end of a busy day rather than going home and getting ready for a later more formal dinner later in the evening.   All in all, good food, good service if you have reservations if this is your first time with Indian food do your homework before getting there and you should be fine.

My boyfriend and I love Indian food and have tried several other places in the area, this one is by far our favorite! The lamb korma is exquisite! The staff is warm and friendly, the restaurant itself is clean and inviting. Truly a unique little hole in the wall and I would recommend this place to anyone in need of some good Indian food!

The food is really great. A couple of us went in there a week or so ago to try it out. Neither of us are too familiar with Indian food and we were a little concerned, but it was amazing. Everything we had was delicious. The restaurant was very clean and the service was excellent. We weren't a fan of the desserts, but everything else was very good. The portions are large, so we had plenty to take home. We will definitely be back soon to try some other items.

I've eaten lots of curry throughout my life.   This curry was just okay.   The menu is massive and offers a lot of variety, for someone unfamiliar with the cuisine it's quite daunting.   Since I was trying out this restaurant for the first time I decided to try something I was very familiar with and ordered a shrimp masala.  The dish was seasoned heavily, like any Indian dish should be, but the flavors didn't really seem to balance out  very well, all of the seasonings tasted a bit off, and were a bit overbearing in a funny tasting way.  But alas, not bad by any means of the imagination.  I cleaned off the plate and would try it again.  The shrimp itself was wonderful, very fresh and well cooked.  The garlic naan was to die for, it was one of the best naans I've ever had.  Cooked to perfection.   Judging from other reviews, I'm not sure if we just came in on an off night or what, but the service was not good at all.  We were probably sitting for 15-20 minutes before someone came over and took our drink orders, and this was not on a busy night.  Our server didn't seem particularly happy to be there.  The food took a little while to come out, but I expect that when ordering more elaborate meals, and was not at all turned off by this.    The restaurant has a little side-shop, which sells British and Indian goodies, which was delightful.  A definite plus.

I have to start off by saying that if you are a fan of Indian food, then this is the place for you.  We were a party of about 20, and they had no problem accommodating us. When we arrived at 6:00, our table was set and waiting for us. The restaurant is nicely decorated, and has a quiet atmosphere. Some of the smaller, intimate tables would be a good place to take a date! But, I digress.  For starters, they brought out a very thin, fragile cracker and 3 different sauces to dip it in. The sauces are not for the faint hearted. I recommend that you order a mango lassi immediately if you need to handle heat.  For starters, I ordered the samosa's, and they were flavorful and cooked to perfection. An assortment of main dishes were ordered ranging from Chicken Tikka Masala to Lamb Vindaloo ordered extra hot, along with a melange of other dishes.  While the heat level might be good for most people, I and one of my companions really like the heat, and we felt that the Tikka Masala and the Vindaloo needed to be even hotter than they were. Then again, a member of our party tried each one of them and pronounced their mouth to be on fire, so perhaps we just have asbestos linings. This restaurant is beautifully clean, including the restrooms.  There is a small store attacked to the restaurant that has everything from ingredients to nicknacks for sale.  Each person in our party enjoyed the dinner, and there was narry a complaint about anything. Service was attentive without being overbearing.  4 stars for quality, cleanliness and service.

I had chicken biryani here..what they served was not even close..din't look or taste like biryani..it was more like pulao/sambar rice(another rice-based Indian dish)..but they do have very delicious entrees...go for the entrees, no biryani please..

I have been to The Dhaba many times in the past, before I started Yelping.  The food, drinks, and Asian lady who runs the place is always first-rate.  In the past, I would have always rated them 5-star.  Last night's visit was different. The food, drinks, and Asian lady who runs the place were very enjoyable as always, however, aside from those elements, improvement was needed.    Firstly, we had to wait for everything.  There was no one up front to greet us for quite some time, so we had to wait to be seated.  Then we had to wait for water and menus.  Next came the long wait for drinks. We did NOT have to wait long for the food, but the waiting kicked-in again when we had to wait for the bill and wait again to have it processed.  By far the most irritating event of the evening is when some old Indian guy upfront (who we have never seen there before) took it upon himself, not only to take forever to work up  the bill, but to add a 20% tip on top of the food, drink and tax charge.  Now there were just four of us dining -- my husband and two kids -- not a large, noisy, demanding party by any means.  He literally added a line with a dollar amount that amounted to 20% of the total bill. To add insult to injury, he also left the "tip" line BLANK, in hopes that I would add even more!!!!!  I wrote "INCLUDED" on the tip line, along with a "nice try" comment.  I definitely would have tipped our nice Asian lady 20%, as we always do, but I resent that some old guy had the audacity to do it for me.  It takes us 30 minutes to drive there from our home, and this last experience will make it questionable if we do so again this year.

Made a reservation and when we arrived, found our table waiting. Service was good, with the exception of waiting to pay the check, which is a personal pet peeve of mine.   I had my standard dish of Lamb Vindaloo. When asked how hot from 1-10 that I would like it, she mentioned it is normally 8. I choose 10 as I am a fan of very hot food. It came as a 7 - spicy, flavorful but not as hot as I would have liked. Still very good, but the portion had too many potatoes and not enough lamb. I am willing to pay $17 for an entree with lamb, it is a rare treat. While tasty, the portion was very skimpy.  My wife's dish was delicious. And ironically seemed spicier than mine.  The nan was very good. Nicely baked. The riata, a yogurt dish used to cool and balance spicy dishes was thicker and the veggies in it smaller than I used to.  Overall good food. I would return.

The Dhaba is definitely one of the best Indian food restaurants in the Valley by far!!!  The other one we like is the Dheli Palace for their lunch buffet.  We usually try a lunch buffet first before deciding whether to invest in dinner cause Indian cuisine is very pricey. Due to all the rave reviews we decided to go for it and have become fans ever since.  We are always surprised when the place is not so busy because the food is excellent.  I think the fact that they do not have a buffet has something to do with this.  For most who are not familiar with the cuisine of India, ordering can be a daunting task which is why buffets really work with Indian food.  I am of Indian decent (1st generation) so I know my way around the dishes and have been able to guide both friends and family through the rich assortment of Indian dishes, but if you don't have a guide it can be a little scary, just saying, a buffet might be the way to go to give business a boost.  We love the Dhaba, give it a shot you will not be disappointed.
Amazing food.  Busy though and pricey. Make reservations ahead of time and get there early so your table is ready by the time your reservation is set for.

All-star Indian food again! My wife and I stepped out for some Indian cuisine this evening and we're delighted yet again with The Dhaba.   I literally opened my Yelp app, looked up my review, we ordered the same things, and it was wonderful. We got a little lively and went with a heat index of 7 this time (too hot for the wife, we're sticking with 6 from now on). Service was on point, food was amazing, atmosphere is authentic.   Thanks again for an amazing dining experience!
Very good food the jalapeo naan was really good?  Very nice atmosphere just like Being in India

The food is good I have always been a regular here more with pick up,after a long day I prefer to call and place my order so i don't have to go there and wait but the time duration specified by them is more than 25 minutes which is a tad too much.  Also they refused the free In House dessert which was a deal on yelp for check in,they said it was not valid on pickup! Wish they would step up the service and make it as good as the food.  I will keep coming back because the food has never disappointed,the service however is questionable!  They also have a little store next door which is great if you're looking for Indian spices.

The food here is amazing. The chicken curry is so tender and delicious. The biryani is fresh and flavorful. The dal is comfort in a bowl. I haven't had as good a cup of chai in a very long time. And, of course, the Badami Kheer (punjabi-style rice pudding) was light and tasty. My only complaint is the drinking water--it seems that The Dhaba uses unfiltered tap water. Highly recommended, though, and we'll definitely be back.

Worst customer service. They serve you wrong dish. Then, not even apologetic about it. Worst, they point out to you that they are doing a great favor to you by not charging the wrongly served dish.....will never visit this place in future.

Pretty good and pretty authentic. I forget which part of India they said the food was from. I dined here on business based on the good Yelp reviews. People are pretty spot on giving this place good reviews. The food was good and felt very "home cooked." It was interesting that the server described the food as "home cooked" as well without my prompting. She gave us a little history of the word "Dhaba" too. The rice was not your typical Indian basmati. It was a little thinner and different consistency and mouth feel. I didn't like that very much. Everything else was pretty tasty.

After getting my car's oil changed at Hon-Man, I was feeling a bit peckish and decided to indulge in some tasty Indian cuisine since The Dhaba was a hop, skip, and a jump away. I wanted an order to-go, and inquired about getting a lunch special (No buffet, but they do have some great looking daily lunch specials). Unfortunately, they will only give you the lunch deals if you eat in, so I browsed through the extensive regular menu. The prices seemed a little high compared to other Indian restaurants in Tempe. I decided on The Dhaba signature saag (Spinach) dish ($12).   There is a cute little waiting area where you can wait for your food to be made. Service was exceptional, especially since it was to-go! The friendly hostess at the counter offered me some water while I waited, and even offered to refresh the cup with more water for my trip back home. The order came in a nice little brown shopping bag with handles, the kind you would find at higher-end restaurants.  When I opened up the bag, I had a really large portion of saag and basmati rice. The saag had a nice balance of flavors and textures. I could taste fresh ginger, some creaminess, and the delicate flavor of the spinach. I had asked for it medium spicy, and it was about right- not too spicy, not too mild. The basmati rice was cooked well, had some vibrantly colored grains and was fragrant from the addition of spices such as cardamom and cumin.  Overall, it was a pleasant meal, and I have more than enough leftovers for a few more meals. I'd love to dine in another time to try out more dishes, and their lunch!

Simply walking in provided me with a promising feeling. This was going to be real authentic Indian cuisine; that I had no doubt about. The air was filled with wafts of spices and herbs that were absolutely mouth-watering. The atmosphere screamed Indian culture and I almost believed I had left the country and entered into India itself. Along with the restaurant there was a quaint little Indian market right next door that was extremely time consuming while they prepared a table for your meal. It was filled with all sorts of Indian delicacies along with Indian clothing and dcor. It most definitely added to the authentic Indian experience.        Once we were seated, we were greeted by an exceptionally friendly waiter who seemed genuinely concerned that we had a pleasurable time. It was clear that his ultimate goal was to make sure we had what we needed when we needed it. It was almost as if he was a mind reader and knew exactly when we needed something. This is one thing that can make or break the dining experience and they nailed it right on the head. The service alone would make me return to The Dhaba.       Finally for the crucial component of any restaurant, the food. Just as everything else I was blown out of the water after taking the first bite of my Murgh Seekh Kabab. It was beyond divine, so much so, I couldn't find the will to put my fork down. The flavors bursted every which way in my mouth; the dhaba spices and herbs which the chicken was marinated in took life. I will have to admit I was a little skeptical before coming to try this food but I must say I am well pleased with everything. The Dhaba is something I would recommend to anyone that is curious to try authentic Indian cuisine.

At 1pm on a Wednesday we were the only customers.  Service was friendly, but slow. The 2 servers/manager were too busy chatting on the phone in the back or eating their own lunch.  Another group departing as we came in seemed to be waiting at the front counter for about 10 minutes for the girl in the office to finish her phone call and close their tab.    Food was good, reasonably priced for a lunch combo with more than enough food.  3 of us ordered the lunch special (2 vegetarian, 1 chicken) which were all good, although the heat level was off.  The 2 vegetarians asked for heat level 3 (offered range of 1-10) while the chicken was requested as a 9.  Both came out around a 5. Why bother asking if you're not going to follow through.  Portions were good but oddly served.  Lunch combo includes salad, chutneys, rice, naan, entree, side, and desert.   For our group of 3 we were served 2 bowls of rice and 2 pieces of naan. We didn't run out, so it was ok, but seemed odd when everything else was served in individual dishes.  We had to ask for the salad and chutneys which were forgotten.  Masala Chai tea (which to me is the barometer of quality for any restaurant) was just ok. Too much fennel/anise flavor, and too thick/heavy being made with a lot of whole milk.    I checked in on yelp (which is how I found the place, after my first choice and favorite Udupi turned out to be closed/out of business!).  Yelp specified it was open for lunch, and offered a $15 for $25 coupon, which I purchased.  It wasn't until the end of the meal and attempting to pay that I was rudely told the promo wasn't valid with the lunch special.  I told her that wasn't mentioned in the terms, she made some excuse and wandered off.   I decided I'd just take it up with Yelp later, and put my card in the folio.  Unfortunately she disappeared and after about 10 minutes of waiting I tracked her down in the office behind the hostess stand, knocking on the door and interrupting her personal phone call.  At that point I was getting upset. with the service and called her out on the yelp promo, insisting that the only restrictions are that it's not valid for takeout or on Fridays/Saturdays. She disagreed but finally said she'd honor it and wrote down the promo code and adjusted my bill.  Overall the food was good but service was unacceptable. Portions and prices if ordering the lunch combo were reasonable but ala-carte and dinner menu pricing were excessive and the portions are probably the same judging by other reviews.  I would not return given the variety of other Indian options in the area.

Food was great. I got the paneer and my boyfriend got the chick pea something-or-other (sorry, I could look it up, but I'm too lazy). The spice levels here are great as well. We both got a 7; definitely enough to make your nose run, but not enough to make the food unbearably hot.  The naan was also fresh and delicious.  I'd definitely go back! Portion sizes are enormous. We had enough for us both to eat a second meal out of it.   Side note: it feels like you're eating in a palace with the silver cups and plates at your table. Ha.

Update to my post. I set the dollar value at $$ but that was with my groupon. The value is a bit higher than that if you have an appetizer, 2 entrees, desert and wine as our Groupin did. Still excellent food

Our favorite Indian place! Fresh, tasty menu. Service is always wonderful. It's often busy, speaking volumes of the food, so reservations are recommended. Very modern and classy decor. One of our most frequented restaurants - and prior to finding this gem, we rarely dined out on Indian Cuisine.

I invited out of town guests out to dinner. They were not big fans of Indian cuisines so I thought I would take them to a favorite of mine. They were apprehensive at first as we had to wait 30 minutes. I told them it is worth the wait. From the moment we sat down they started to get excited. They warned us that the food takes a little bit to prepare as everything is made from scratch. After a pleasant wait or food was served. They were thrilled and said they have a new found love for the food. For me I know just how good it is at The Dhaba. My joy was sharing such a great meal with my friends and them having that kind of reaction. Still the best in my book.

I love this restaurant! I feel like this is what Indian dining should be like. The setting and the service are great. And the food!! I feel like this is the best I've come across in Arizona. It might be a little more than other Indian restaurants but I think it's worth it. The food is delicious and I would recommend this place to anyone.

I have never had Indian food until I visited The Dhaba. The moment I walked in, there was an overwhelming smell of spice. My husband thought it was great. I struggled to breathe. It wasn't a bad smell, it was REALLY strong. I recovered from my asthma attack and was able to take in the whole atmosphere. There was a guy in the corner playing music quietly, and only a few tables in the whole place. We had a reservation, but they were unaware of needing to have a high chair ready so, we had to wait a couple minutes. No big deal. We listened to the guy in the corner and made faces at each other to pass the time with a three year old. While we waited a couple walked in for a table. They were told that without a reservation it would be more than a 30 minute wait. They left. We didnt. We were directed to our table covered with shiny silver tableware except one thing: A plastic cup with Mickey Mouse, specifically for my son to use during his visit (he happens to like the mouse ). We were left to figure out the extensive menu without a clue to start with. And even right after it was ordered, I couldn't tell you what it was. There was vegetarian rice and chicken and lamb. All of it was very flavorful and very spicy! We were asked to rate the heat we wanted. I learned the hard way, 5 is still pretty hot and it is WAY different than Mexican food spice! The food was remarkable. The service is just meh. The price was also what I would consider average. My son only ate the flat bread (naan?), he didn't want to try anything else, but for the three of us it was only around $40. I was so full leaving there with good food sitting in my belly. We will probably go back another time.

Use to be our favorite Indian restaurant, driving out of our way just to dine there . We came on a Sunday at 7:00 p.m., last day of "Restaurant Week in PHX" to take advantage of the $40 special. We were greeted and seated right away from a young lady who was the Hostess, Order taker and Drink server.   The young lady finally got around to our table after waiting a bit to take out drink order and menu order. We decided to go with the Restaurant Week PHX $40 which changed when we got there to $44 special. We ordered our whole meal up front 1st. course: Bombay Bhel Puri (crisp puffed rice, onions, potatoes, cilantro), 2nd. course: 2 Kashmiri Chicken Tikka Masala (level of hotness a 6 and an 8), 3rd. course: Kulfi (ice cream made with pistachios, cardamom seeds).  I can honestly say we were very disappointed overall, the wait to take our order was long and the wait to get our drinks (beers) was long. What was not a long wait was to give us our bill which I noted on the Web site for Restaurant week we were to be charged only $40 not $44. The 1st. course we ordered was OK I just think it was personal taste. The 2nd. course which we've had many times had very little chicken, the spice levels we requested were tame (again we frequent here quit a bit, so we know). The Naan was chewy and doughy. To top it off, our dessert was delivered and we were told they ran out so they gave a mango ice cream that I did NOT like, but mean while 2 tables down got the pistachio Ice cream (they arrive well after we did). We were told by the young lady "well they just pick it out of a container and you get what you get".  Really? I took note that the young lady was not very friendly, an abrupt manner to everyone, workers and diners. What happen? when the Mother and Father Owners were there the service ran much smoother, food was excellent even for the $$. The food which I raved about was not good, the Naan was horrible and the dessert mess up and at $44 there frankly was no savings cost.  Sorry service OK, wait bad, food OK and for the $ price this is the last time.

After hearing a lot of good reviews about Dhaba, I decided to check this place out. We started with Chicken Tikka as the appetizer. It was very bland and dry with no appreciable amount of spice on it. The platter on which it was brought out was burning the Tikka. The things started getting worse from there.  The sauce with the entree lacked any spice or color. Seemed like tomatoes and some spices were put in a blender, churned and served with peas and paneer. Chicken biryani was nowhere close to a biryani with some generic spices mixed with rice and chicken. And the final nail in the coffin was the exorbitantly priced items. Safe to say, this will be the first and last time, I visit this place.
My favorite Indian restaurant in town. This is coming from an Indian.  My go to items: somosa, pani puri, chicken makhani, tandoori chicken, Naan, and chicken biryani.
I do see why this is a five-star yelp restaurant. The quality of the food and service met all my expectations. I also like to think I'm a foodie! I of course tried the chicken tiki masala.

After purchasing a Living Social voucher for The Dhaba, we decided to try it out on a Tuesday evening. To preface, the food was fantastic. I was very impressed. I highly recommend trying one of their entrees prepared in their tandoor oven. The naan bread, both plain and chili infused, was delicious.   However, their service was below average. Granted, they did have a large party dining with them. But there seemed to be only one waitress for the entire dining room. It took about 15 minutes for her to even glance our way and then greet us. Once greeted, she asked if we were ready to order, which of course we were not as we had many questions about the menu. I was given the wrong glass of wine and had to wait even longer for my beverage.   Again, the food was great. And I certainly plan on trying it out again, especially as it's so conveniently located. My recommendation to The Dhaba is to provide the appropriate amount of staff needed to run a successful business, especially when doing a promotional deal for guests, thus increasing traffic.

I'm not sure if it's different when you eat at this restaurant compared to getting it delivered, but I just did Uber Eats from Dhaba and it was pretty terrible.  The food seemed like it had been sitting since lunch.   Based on the overall 4 star I'm assuming the food needs to be eaten fresh and at the restaurant.  Anyways, I just wanted to warn anyone thinking about getting delivery.
Great Indian food, great ambiance and dining atmosphere. Fast friendly service and average prices. Will definitely come back again
Their Naan bread is so good, tastes better than others...we ordered all sorts of stuff and it was all really tasty and yum.

All of the Indian food places I go to are usually the same old same old, and upset my stomach. The Dhaba has extremely tasty food you will not regret, super cute set up, and our waitress was very friendly and recommended my dishes and my beer. She has good taste! I can't wait to go back. My mouth waters every time I think about it. YUMMMM.
Hands down my favorite restaurant I've tried in the Phoenix area in the year I've been here. Great food, great service, reasonable prices (especially if you Groupon it).

I LOVE Indian food, so I requested Indian food for my birthday dinner, and the family took me here, even though it was a bit of a drive.   Since we had reservations, my party of four were seated immediately at a table with really cool silverware and plates, plus the best "goblet" I've ever drunk water from! As the dinner progressed, Mark H. commented that those goblets didn't sweat. Sure enough, the goblet was keeping my water chilled but wasn't sweating. Cool!   The hostess and waitress were incredibly attentive, and we also had the opportunity to talk with the owners! Take time to read some of the information about how civic-minded these owners are (on the left wall when you walk in). They truly support the local community.   The food? I'm not sure what we ordered, as I let my hubby take care of the ordering (since the national dish where he hails from is Tikki Masala). The food, however, all tasted yummy. You must have the garlic naan though to go with whatever dish you order, and top your meal off with the Chai tea (best ever).   Great place! I'll be back, as I'd like to visit their grocery store next door and experience more of their tasty dishes.

After seeing such great reviews by yelpers, I decided to dine in for dinner. As I entered through the door, I realized I made a mistake. The place was just crowded with Indian handicrafts, which instead of giving an ethnic look seemed to be a misfit. The seating appeared not cozy but just as if u r sitting in a narrow street. I started with an appetizer, the pappri chaat which gave me such a hard time eating it all, that I could not even finish half the plate and decided to leave. Not a good experience. Won't recommend at all.

Went to The Dhaba for the first time during restaurant week so we could try their different entrees.  We had made a reservation and were seated immediately. Service was fantastic! Our server explained in great detail the menu and gave us recommendations based on our tastes. He was extremely helpful. We each started with a glass of house wine and they brought out some Pappadums, which are lightly fried Lentil Wafers. Delicious with the 3 different sauces/chutneys. Followed by the Bombay Bhel Puri. So delicious and light and refreshing. I could've made a meal of it.  Our entrees were the  Kashmir Tika Masala #7 spice level, which was delicious and so authentic. Best we've ever had. We also had the Vegetable Korma, #8 spice level, also delicious. For dessert we both had the Bhadami Khmer which we had never had. It's an Indian rice pudding. Very good and a perfect compliment to our dinner along with a cup of Masala Chai. We will definitely be back and look forward to trying other entrees.  Can't say enough about the great service! Outstanding!!!!

We have returned to the Dhaba several times since my 1 star review and I'm a bit embarrassed to discover that I have not updated my review until now.  Restaurants can have bad days and after visiting Dhaba on multiple occasions since my last review, I'm convinced I caught them on an "off night". food and service in our subsequent visits has brought as back to Dhaba as regular customers and we would recommend this Indian restaurant to anyone looking for a place to call their favorite!  The past several times we've been here, the food has been great and the staff is friendly and helpful.  We love the papadum with the trio of chutneys that are served complimentary while deciding what to order.  The korma is wonderful as are the tandoori and vegetarian dishes we've had.  The Indian spices are spot on and the naan is so good that we always need another order.   We like our food spicy, but for those of you who like a more mild dish, Dhaba will customize your order to please.  Dhaba has become our favorite Indian restaurant in the valley and we dine her regularly.
Stopped in for a quick lunch special. I had the chicken curry. It had good flavor and it was a lot of food for the money. And service was excellent.

Love this place, and I'm here on Valentine's Day with the people I love.  Coincidence?  No, you can thank Groupon and the fact that we didn't get a baby sitter, and, did I mention, my wife also loves this place.  What about grandma you ask?  Does she love this place?  Who knows, she's coming anyway.  The menu now indicates such things as gluten free, vegetarian, and vegan for each item.  That's good because I avoid those categories like cooked carrots and water chestnuts.  Orders are served on an arrangement of copper bowls.  The chicken vindaloo is actually a little spicy. Seating is limited, so a reservation is recommended.  I'll see you at The Dhaba.  I just feel cool saying the name. . . to myself as I finish typing this review.

The best Indian food in Arizona. The owner is one of the finest people you will ever meet in your life. Everything about the place is special. All of the food is fresh and made on premises daily. Treat yourself to something unique.
Outstanding flavor, spicy as a bastard, and good beer and wine. A bit pricey for sure, but worth it occasionally. The adjacent Indian store is cool but even more overpriced.

My favorite Indian food  I love this place. Although they don't have my favorite dish anymore (something like aloo chaat.) but everything here is good and I love the metal dish wear and the decor. It's rather slow and a bit expensive, as are many Indian restaurants, but if you're in the mood for a relaxing evening and great food, give it a try.
Nice smaller restaurant. Good service. Awesome vegetable korma.

Loved the atmosphere and the food very much! I would definitely come back and I would say makes it in to my Top 3 Indian restaurants in Phoenix. Definitely high up there in terms of the cute atmosphere. Can't wait to come back and go to the little market next door.

Wow! This has to be the best Indian food we have had in the Phoenix-area for some time. We do not like very spicy food so we were hesitant (have ordered things mild or 1 at other places and still had it be really super hot). However, everything we ordered was spiced just exactly as we like it! The food was all so flavorful and everything seemed very fresh. The meat was of good quality and without gristle or fat. The only downside was the online ordering wasn't working. :( Hopefully they fix it because we want to order from here again!

Been coming here for years. Have tried every Indian restaurant in Tempe, and the majority of Phoenix not to mention other states. Best Indian cuisine I've ever had. not much else to say, love The Dhaba!

I am by no means an expert on India cuisine. My experience is limited to dozens of buffets and a single non-buffet experience a friend took me to in Manhattan. While that was good, this was awe-inspiring.  The Dhaba is NOT a buffet restaurant. They serve fresh Punjabi food and have an extensive menu. But not at lunch during the week. Their innovative approach is to rotate through the best items on their menu each week. We ate their on a Thursday. We skipped the two vegetarian entrees and went straight for the chicken and lamb. Both were melt-in-your-mouth outstanding. Both were spiced for flavor, not simply heat. I'm a huge fan of hot food, but it wasn't until driving out of the parking lot that I realized how not-hot the food had been. Amazing.  We had the Mur Lasuni Tikka (chicken) and the Kali Marichi Ka Gosht (lamb). Served family style, with fantastic madras lentils (they probably call it something different), yogurt sauce (taziki?) , naan that perfectly complimented the meal instead of overpowering it, and a lovely salad with a mango-and-lots-of-other-good-stuff dressing.  The lovely lady there took the time to explain everything to us and made the experience that much better. And since they rotate the lunch menu every day during the week -- full menu on the weekends and for dinner -- I have good reason to return at least four more times this month!

Amazing selection followed by delicious food. Will definitely come back and recommend to others. The service was also helpful and on point. Won't go elsewhere for the authentic atmosphere and taste. Two thumbs up.

Love the Somosas here! I have tried many from all over and this is the best here in this area! Trust me well worth ever penny and calorie! All things on menu that we have tried have been GREAT! It is a place that for such a tiny place they sure can cook!

This place is a hidden gem. We were there for restaurant week. The food was outstanding as was the service. The staff were very nice and pleasant as well as attentive. I cannot recall the names of the food we ordered but it was the best Indian food I have ever tasted. I highly recommend this place. We will be back.  Don't forget to check out the market that is located to the eastern part of the dining room.    The chai was also very tasty and delicious.

Looking for gluten free restaurants that deliver, found this place on grubhub and they listed gluten free and vegetarian menu items right there in the grubhub app.    I did call ahead to verify a couple items and the gentleman who answered the phone was very nice and informative.   So I ordered the cornmeal rhoti and a chicken meal with jasmine rice.   Food was great if not a bit mild for my taste but great flavor.  The cornmeal rhoti was surprisingly tasty.    My new favorite place when I'm down in this area of Tempe.

My wife and I just had a very enjoyable dining experience @ The Dhaba.  We had the tandoori shrimp to start, and chicken tiki masala as our main dish.  This place will not disappoint. I've eaten Indian food my entire life, at many different places, and I can tell you with confidence that this place is legit.   If you're on the fence about trying it out, give it a go, you will not regret it!

This was my 3rd visit to the restaurant. The food taste good here which is the reason for my 3rd visit. This time we ordered the lunch combo and the food items was predecided by the restaurant.  The lentil soup (daal) which was served to us was stale. I think almost 1-2 day old. On checking with server, they changed the dish to fresh one however manager or server did not really care about the stale food which I already ate. it taste bad, it smells stale.  I wish I don't get into health issue due to this. Warning !!!  Please make sure you smell ur food before you eat here.

We (Husband and I) love The Dhaba. Our first two visits were pretty different from each other, so we waited until our third visit to formulate a solid opinion on the place. It's a very thorough four stars for us!  The food is five-star good. It's that simple.  We love the crisp, cumin-laced poppadums (spelled many ways once translated to English: pappadams, papadums, etc.) they serve while you wait for your order and the choice of three sauces. Husband dips with the chili sauce; I mix the sweet tamarind sauce and the chili sauce.  Their chicken tikka masala contains very tender chicken, and consistently has a nice spice blend, level of cilantro, and velvety texture. We find it sometimes has a little less chicken in it than the chicken makhani (makhani murgh), and Husband isn't a sauce guy, but he orders it every time anyway.  The murgh makhani (often translated as butter chicken) is tied for the best I've ever had. The sauce is a rich, as the name would suggest, blend of butter, pureed tomato, and cream, and it is studded with plump golden sultanas (NOT RAISINS, GUYS--these are not hard, chewy blobs) and cashews. The chicken has its trademark bright red skin and is so, so, so tender. Seriously. So tender.  Their mango lassis are the best I've ever had, and I've had Indian all over the place--NYC, London... they are thick, fruity, and perfectly sweet, which means not overly sweet, not under-sweetened.  The garlic naan is superb; we always order two. They use real minced garlic and it is always a nice balance of crisp and tender. No gummy naan at The Dhaba.  Great gulab jamun, but like most Indian places, they cost quite a bit.  The service is where I quibble--the staff are super nice, and super personable. The kitchen just seems to be slow. Our first visit, we waited a longish time, but not so much that we noticed anything out of the ordinary. On our second visit, we waited a full fifty minutes from the time we ordered to the time we received any food--naan included. It all came out together fifty minutes after we ordered it. Eek. There were only a few other patrons in the restaurant at the time, too. The food was still blow-our-minds good, so we decided to give them one more chance, and we're glad we did, because the wait was very reasonable our third time, and the staff especially attentive. (AND they brought the naan out for us to graze on while we waited--perfect.)  In short--eat at The Dhaba. The food is outstanding, the wait time is tolerable, and the staff are kind.
Food here is delicious, vegan friendly, and service is always fantastic. If you don't know what to order, the servers are helpful and will walk you through the menu.
16 dollars for these? Tastes kinda like the curry that you can have in Thai restaurant and it only cost you around 10 dollars.  Definitely not worth the money. Won't go back again

This place was right near an old apartment of mine. The food is authentic and delicious. Customer service 10/10. Had barely no wait time. Water was kept full and waitress was very attentive. Next time I get my Indian food crave on, I know where I am going!

This is my favorite Indian restaurant in the valley.  Their curries are very flavorful and spicy.  I usually get their Vindaloo, although I've had the Dhaba curry, and a couple others (both lamb and chicken).  The Naan is great, and we've been given a couple desserts on the house that were fun and interesting.  They do a good job of trying to find some stuff for our kids to eat, but we usually just bring something along for them to have with basmati rice.  My wife gets their Chiken Tikka Masala, and she loves it.  We often go here for lunch, which is not a buffet (which we prefer).

Really enjoyed this place! It is really good quality but a little on the pricey side for Indian food. The staff there is great and really accommodating as well. Definitely can't wait to visit here again!

Eating at The Dhaba was my first Indian food experience, and I will say I was pleasantly surprised. I tried their chicken tikka masala, the chicken curry, the biryani and some tandoori chicken. I ordered spice level 5. It was perfect, not too hot but enough to leave a slight burn on my tastebuds. The tikka masala tastes like a buttery, creamy tomato soup. The chicken curry was perfectly done, the chicken falling apart and moist. The naan tasted fresh baked and you could taste the salt and garlic on the garlic naan. It was so good, the naan was probably the best part. I also got a dish of some yogurt sauce which was nice and cooled down some of the heat, and a bowl of lentils to dip stuff in and it was very tasty too. We also got a thin, papery tortilla type bread with some little cups of sauces to dip it in, sort of like an indian tortilla, and this was a very nice touch and very authentic as I've never had anything like it. The biryani was a large helping and I kept find myself wanting to take more bites even as I became more and more full, it was just very flavorful and the foreign tastes to it was very pleasant. If there was anything that was something I could complain about, it was the chicken tandoori, which was hunks of chicken breast with a yogurt and spice dressing, but really it was just a dry sort of chicken breast with some spicy flavoring. Still, it was cooked through if not a little dry, but I get the impression there is supposed to be something more to it than just cooked sliced chicken breast with some marinade. The server was nice, prompt with drinks, and because the restaurant was very small we got consistent attention and it was not hard to ask a passing server for a drink refill or more rice. The basmati rice was also very flavorful and helped offset some of the heat from the sauces. We also got the rice pudding dessert which tasted very much like rice pudding, but I am also not a big rice pudding fan or a dessert person. Overall, I enjoyed it so much the next day I was craving it! It really was that good. It is not in the best location ever and the building is a little drab, but otherwise really worth going. To the people saying this place does not have good indian food, well, I am not an expert in Indian food, but I will say I tried another Indian place near me a few days later because I really wanted some yummy chicken masala but didnt want to drive to tempe and guess what, it really was not anywhere near The Dhaba. If you get a chance to go I would recommend it. Others are saying it was very expensive? But, compared to other places I really don't think it is. You can easily spend anywhere from 10 and up a person at most mainstream restaurants, and this place was no different but the food sure did taste great.   Tip: go early because as other reviewers have said if you show up late they will turn you down, they close promptly at 9:00pm and finish seating earlier than that.

This was delish! And I love that they had clear marking on what was vegan on the menu. We asked for 7 out of 10 spicy, and it was still pretty mild for me. The cauliflower had the most kick, but not overwhelming. Next time I will try 9 or 10. And there will definitely be a next time!

The food is not worth the price. They use a lot of food Colors to make the food look spicy. The chicken did taste fresh. We ordered a total of 8dishes and the only saving grace was their lamb seekh kebab. I wouldn't go back to this place.

We came with a large group and service was sloooow. The highlight for me was definitely the vegetarian appetizer plate - an assortment of flavorful fried bites that were worth coming back for!  Dinner course was just okay - It seemed like almost everyone at the table felt that their dishes were mostly sauce with very little "stuff" in them. Kind of made us feel like we weren't getting much for our money. Also, "medium" spicy was not spicy at all.  Very nice atmosphere and decor.

Food was good but, spice level was not consistent with previous visits ( much spicier last night) Service was OK, but I felt we were being rushed, the wait staff told us at 9pm that the kitchen was closing and they seemed a bit too eager to take our plates away (I was still eating!) Sadly the management's inability (reluctance?) to honor the remaining balance on our Dhaba gift card left a sour taste at the end of the evening. Their excuse was that their machine wasn't working although they were able confirm that we had a balance of $5.68, but told us we would need to come back some other time and use it.  Hopefully it will be better in 2016.

1. The Dhaba cooking school is a lot of fun and you learn so much about Indian Cuisine. The Instructor is great, and it is very hands on. We even made Paneer!  2. The restaurant itself is very good, a lot of great aromas, spices and flavors and one of the better Indian Restaurants in the greater Phoenix Area.

Excellent Food, Great Service, Nice Ambience, Modest Price.  Had Dinner multiple times - will recommend Chicken Curry and Chicken Biryani.  Naan can be a bit softer and serving a bit larger for dinner.  Overall I would highly recommend the place. Easy access from Metro Line  Would like to see fresh juices on the Menu - Fresh

3rd time here and still just as good. Love this place. Food : awesome You also get to pick your spice level! Ok for all types of eaters. If you want to try curry but don't want the spice this is the place to check out.

Wanted to try authentic Indian food for a while and finally had the opportunity to check it out with some friends (the hubby is not as adventurous when it comes to food). I chose this place for the location and the yelp ratings and reviews.   I made 5pm reservations using open table which was simple and easy. When we showed up however, it took several minutes before we were greeted and shown our table. There were only two other tables occupied at the time so they were not busy at all. The host/server was nice though. The decor was tastefully done and the table settings and silver dishes gave the place a high class touch. It was also very clean.  For our first time, the menu was overwhelming. I've heard of a few dishes such as tikki masala and butter chicken. So we decided to order that plus two others that we weren't as familiar with.  I chose an appetizer that was described as a little bit of everything.  So I assumed it would be a platter type item so everyone could share, grab with their fingers and taste. When we received our appetizer it was not what I expected. Literally,  almost everything listed on the appetizer section was included in this dish covered with a yogurt type sauce sitting in a edible crispy shell. We asked how we were to go about eating it. The server told us to grab the spoon and break it off in pieces since each section held a different treat. So we did.  It was different but tasty. Would I order it again?  Probably not.  Our main dish was very spicy but that was to be expected. I had just enough rice to curry ratio to finish my meal. But my favorite part of the meal was the garlic naan. I loved it! I'd eat that all day. Also, if you check in through yelp you receive a free house dessert which was a rice pudding. I'm usually not a fan of rice puddings but it really helped balance out all the spices I just ate. So I basically gobbled that up.  The reason I'm only giving 3 stars was because we were not able to use our Groupon. After reading other yelp reviews, I noticed many referring to the special on Groupon which was to purchase $16 for $30 worth of food.  I bought the Groupon today to use today. But the server told us we were not able to use it because we have to wait 24 hours before use otherwise the system would not accept it. Then she said to come back and use it at a later time. There was nothing specific in the fine print about not being able to use in the same day.  Well I will not be back and hopefully I will be able to get a refund from Groupon.   Overall, the food was okay. It's just not my preference. But I plan on trying other places closer to where I live.  Maybe I just have to find the right dish.
AMAZING every time I go they impress me. The food is incredible and the service is spot on.

Best Indian food in the state. Been to every "taste of India" you can imagine and this place takes the crown. Amazing vegetarian options, craft beers and wines. Service isn't the best but you won't have to worry, the food will make up for anything. The owner is super friendly and will make sure your enjoying everything. The nann is some of the best I've ever had. Get the korma or the tiki masala. Love this place and the market has some really cool stuff.

Great authentic Indian food and excellent service.  We made a reservation here for New Years Eve based on the good reviews and close proximity to where we were vacationing.  We had multiple servers including the owner, making sure our drink glasses stayed full throughout our dinner.  Everyone was friendly and engaging.  The garlic naan and palak paneer were flavorful and the palak had a nice amount of hot spice.  We received a free dessert for our Yelp check in as well, which was a nice treat.  The owner here really seemed to take pride in providing a great dining experience.

This place is consistently good!!!  The lamb korma is excellent, creamy with pine nuts you can actually taste and the lamb is not fatty. Tandoori dishes always smell amazing, I keep meaning to try them, but get distracted by the curries because they are so good. The naan is ok, I always get Paratha because I like it better. The service is a little slow, but the food is worth it. Also, they have street treats on the menu that always make me want to drool, but they are never available when we are there :(

Delicious lunch today at The Dhaba Favorites were: Pindi Chole (fried bread and curried chickpeas), Sharabi Kababi Gosht (lamb with spinach, ginger, garlic and spices) and Machi Masaledar (aka Fish Vindaloo, hot hot hot!).

Do not use their delivery service! We ordered our food and it took almost two hours to deliver it. I called the restaurant and apparently the driver was looking for the house. Okay. Maybe he should be calling me then instead of the other way around. I always use app delivery services but this time I just went with yelp. In the future I will know better.  No surprise the food was cold. Ugh.
Delicious. We ordered the chicken tikka masala and the butter chicken and both were great, We actually went back again two days later.

The food and ambiance both are very good. The food was very tasty. The 5 stars are only for food. For cost it would be 3.5 stars. It seems to be little more costly as compared to other Indian restaurant in Phoenix/Tempe/Chandler area.  For ex: Veg Thali was around $17+tax which only includes 2 curry, 1 daal, 1 naan, rice, small portion of desert with Masala Tea. This is not enough for the price which has been asked.  I had Thali in other indian restaurant but they provided more items in less price.  Hoping that they will add more items in Thali which can justifies it's price.

I came here on a date, having read good reviews and knowing friends who like it here... and I was less than impressed.  First off, I made reservations, and we still had to wait. We were right on time, there were empty tables, and I was a little confused. After being sat by our wholly unenthusiastic hostess-slash-waitress, we waited FOREVER to get in our drink order. We perused the huge menu for quite some time, thought about getting an appetizer, but ended up skipping the app because we figured we would be there all night long if we did. (in retrospect, a smart move.)  When the food came, it was pretty good, but a little bland. I'd maybe try different dishes if there's a next time. I could see people complaining that the portions are on the smaller side, but I thought they were OK. Not great, but okay.   Minus a star for the fact that our wine never came until our food showed up, and I had to politely remind our server. Being on a date, this really was killer. Would have been nice to loosen up convo with a nice glass of wine, and we ended up both getting one glass instead of two.   All in all, super disappointing. Thought it was going to be a fun, interesting experience, and looked forward to doing something different. But this place is firmly OUT of my "dating restaurants" rotation. Maybe I'll come back with friends? If we had a super nice waitress who suggested dishes and treated us well, it could have been great. (and, it doesn't have a very romantic ambiance... we were so far apart when sitting at our "table for 2" that we joked about having convo via carrier pigeon.)   Factor in the fact that it's kind of expensive, and yeah... 2 stars all the way.

Tastiest Indian food we've had! Soooooo good. So so good. The vegetarian options are great, a nice place where carnivores & herbivores can enjoy their dining experiences together.   Check in on Yelp for your free dessert!

Very good Indian food, this is first place I experienced Indian,  and I have been hooked ever since. This is my go to spot for Chicken Tikka Masala....it's super flavorful and is always good.  I do wish they gave more chicken in the dish,  but it's a good because i usually use the remaining curry for my Basmati rice..mmmm.  The service is fast! I call in my orders and I never have to wait, which is a plus.  My addiction  for Indian curry is quite abnormal...lol, but nonetheless,  i can always count on getting a great meal here.

Excellent food coupled with simple and refreshing setup. There is a sense of rusticness about the place and it tries to bring out the dhaba feel. Malai kofta and dhal were fresh and tasty. Many Indian restaurants service mild food inspite of requests for Indian spicy but this was spot on. Not the typical paprika spicy but the strength of masala was good.

So GOOD.  It's beautiful inside, the service is very nice, and the FOOD is truly wonderful.  I reccomend...everything. A word of warning though.  Do NOT mess around when they ask how spicy you would like it.  They are not screwing around.  I'm normally a 8 or 9 kind of guy, but here I won't creep past a 6. Ever.
